availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Wall Applegate (Hamilton County, Ohio, attorney.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, attorney and commissioner of deeds. New Jersey native. Married to Mary Williams Applegate in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio on July 12, 1847. Father of Theophilus Applegate, John William Applegate, James A. Applegate, and Mary E. Applegate. Attorney in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio in 1850. Attorney in Hamilton County in 1860. Employed Rachel Robinson as a domestic servant Hamilton County in 1860. Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Ohio in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, p. 163B.
"Demise of Mr. John W. Applegate," The Cincinnati Enquirer (Cincinnati, Ohio), January 23, 1874, p. 8.
KYR-0001-017-0237.
